title: SAMSUNG The Frame 2020 Series 138 cm (55 inch) QLED Ultra HD (4K) Smart TV  (QA55LS03TAKXXL)

product_specification.In The Box: 1N LED TV,1N POWER CORD,2N BATTERY-ALKALINE(AA SIZE),1N REMOCON,1N STAND-LEFT,1N STAND-RIGHT,1N OC
product_specification.Other Audio Features: Active Voice Amplifier, Adaptive Sound+, Dolby Digital Plus
product_specification.Supported App - Others: SonyLiv, Eros Now, Jio Cinema, Gaana, Youtube, Facebook, Spotify, India Today, Aaj Tak, Sun Next, Big Flix
product_specification.Content Providers: Netflix, Prime Video, Apple TV, Zee5, Hotstar
product_specification.Other Remote Control Features: One Remote Control for all functions
product_specification.Other Convenience Features: Brightness and motion sensor, One connect box, Filmmaker mode
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year Comprehensive Warranty on Product and 1 Year Additional warranty on Panel
product_specification.Covered in Warranty: Defect Arising Out of Faulty, Defective Material or Workmanship are Covered in Warranty
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: Warranty does not Cover Any External Accessories (Such as Battery, Cable, Carrying Bag), Damage Caused to the Product due to Improper Installation by Customer, Normal Wear and Tear to Magnetic Heads, Audio, Video, Laser Pick-ups and TV Picture Tubes, Panel, Damages Caused to the Product by Accident, Lightening, Ingress of Water, Fire, Dropping or Excessive Shock, Any Damage Caused due to Tampering of the Product by An Unauthorised Agent, Liability for Loss of Data, Recorded Images or Business Opportunity Loss
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details: We'll facilitate the installation and demo through authorized service engineer at your convenience. The installation will be done within 48 hours of delivery of the TV. The service engineer will install your new TV, either on wall mount or on table top. Installation and demo are provided free of cost. The engineer will also help you understand your new TV's features. The process generally covers: Wall-mounted or table-top installation, as requested. Physical check of all ports, including power and USB ports. Accessories also checked. Demonstration of features and settings. Quick run-through on how to operate the TV

product_description.QLED Technology: Thanks to Samsung’s Quantum Dot technology, this TV produces visuals with 100% color volume. Also, the Dual LED technology delivers enhanced contrast according to the backlight temperature. These features make the visuals on the screen look clear and detailed even when it is viewed from a wide angle.
product_description.The Frame: Its elegant frame complements your space, making it look like an excellent piece of art in your home.

review:
Splendid product, nice installation system within few hours, vibrant colours filled with nature like pigments.
Thanks# Samsung India ,# Flipkart.

Beautiful tv.... Amazing quality. This Qled 55 inch in this range is the best option for people who are wanting the latest qled and hdmi technology.
Go for it.

The Frame- as the name suggests is more for as a decor than being a TV. You can get a better configuration TV at a cheaper price but this one has an edge due to its aesthetics.
In standby mode the image gallery gives a look as if an art piece is hanging on a wall. The wallpaper can be put in a slideshow and it keeps on changing.
One Connect is another feature which makes this TV almost wire free. Due to its zero space stand the Frame almost attaches to the wall without any gap.

Writing this after just 3 days of usage.

The Frame TV stays true to its title. The art mode really gives a feel of having a real high quality painting hanging on your wall

Pros
- Picture Quality : The movies look amazing on the TV. The picture produced looks almost real .Even the quality with Tata sky is good
-Sound: Better than what you would expect from a TV. Slight base too gives an additional zing.Although ,I have to keep the sound level above 60 mostly.The TV is not so loud even at full volume.
- Art Mode : This is what you should buy the TV for. Don't forget to avail the 3 months free subscription
- Remote : Minimal and feels premium to hold (Except the volume and channel button which are slightly flimsy)
-Ambient Mode : Music visualizer is a cool feature
- You can install the most popular apps
- Tizen OS : Runs super fast and smooth on the tv

Cons
- Universal remote is a little buggy with Tata Sky with back function not working and some more issues
- Bixby is not the best voice assistant out there.Takes 2/3 narrations to do what i am asking it to do
-Art mode doesn't have a slideshow mode (or I couldn't find it)
-App store still is not as rich as android tv

Other Observations
- No indication on one connect box whether its on or off
- The engineer is more scared than you to handle the one connect cable

Overall , If you are looking for a new TV in this price range,This will give you the most differentiated experience

& Impress your guests with the art mode

Well done Samsung !

Excellent TV for the price we opted for the 50" as the viewing distance was comfortable for us,At first i thought the 50" wont be as good as 55" but to my surprise it is fantastic as the volume is sufficient for the room consideration 20w viewing angles are great using this TV for 1 month and can definitely say worth the buy rather than LG & Sony in this range as they won't offer Qled at this price & their Oled's are more than 1L,The 4k looks excellent with major OTT platforms (Netflix, Amazon prime,Hotstar) Ai upscaling is also great1080p is also great dosent look like a downgrade at all.Also the concept of no gap wall mount is awesome which generally no other companies offer whic looks cool as there is negligible gap between tv and wall which offer much cleaner looking Fame look to your TV.Just go for it you won't regret.👍

This is the first high-value product I have brought online and this TV is amazing.

Pros:
-Awesome Display
-Awesome Flipkart and Samsung Installation service.
-Amazing Audio Quality. Thank god it has a 40W speaker for 55inch. I would recommend going with 40W speaker TV.

Cons:
-It's costly. as per the concept of FRAME TV, I don't think in India it will help unless you have a big wall with many frames and I don't think so anyone would keep the TV switch on while leaving home or sleeping for Art Display.
-It's Frame TV without giving Frame and there is no way to find a Frame online in India, not on Flipkart or on Samsung site.

If you find similar tv with the same specifications at a lower price, it's worth thinking about.

Giving 5 Stars rating for the Audio, Display quality, and Service of the Flipkart.

I got this only for my PS5. QLED and 120Hz Refresh Rate were my major reasons to choose this TV and now super happy with my purchase. Crystal clear visuals and butter smooth gameplay. Also watching movies feel like being infront of a theatre because of its booming speakers. Trust me you wont require any external speakers for this TV. Blindly go for it. ❤

Excellent buy, value for money. If you are looking for a tv in the 75-90k budget, then samsung frame is the best choice right now. The most value for money tv, no other brand comes close in this price sector. The frame concept is excellent but even without it, the TV stands high on its picture and performance. The Tizen os is a bit laggy but besides that this is the best tv to buy, the 55 inch version is most aggressively priced and should be the one to be bought. :)

The frame experience hanging on the wall is great.
Good quality material, high clarity picture display, ease of operation, good sound output, best part is just one single wire to the TV and there is no clutter of wires... Awesome

Gift for my parents and Good product must buy. But in my area it is first TV no other have and installation person was also new for that. I don't know whether he installed properly or not. As TV say no gap wall mounting but gap is there. Samsung has to Verify the installation once. Request please forward to Samsung. Thank you.

Thanks# Samsung India ,# Flipkart.

Do take a look at RTings review to make sure that you setup pictures correctly.

I upgraded from 32 Sony TV to this (50 inch) with a viewing distance of 10 -11 feet. And it fit in just fine.

I was bit sceptical about spending such a big amount of money for a television but this TV didn't disappoint me. Switching from a conventional led TV I was amazed by the picture quality of this TV.

Pros:
1. Awesome picture quality, colors are punchy and picture is sharp. Watched 4k content on Netflix and it looked spectacular. 1080p videos are up-scaled and looked decent (better than my old full HD led TV).

2. Sound quality was decent as TV has 40W sound output. Dialogues were clear and 50% volume was good enough for a mid-sized room. Don't expect too much of bass out the TV speakers but it felt adequate for my taste.

3. Looks and overall design is pretty neat and looks great. Frames USP is art gallery being a part of your TV and it showcases paintings once TV is ideal. You can use it to display images from your personal collection or make collage of your photos and display on it. Overall it felt good and there were enough customisation available within art gallery.

4. Coming to delivery and installation, Flipkart did an awesome job of delivering TV within two days of ordering and installation was done the very next day of delivery.

5. Remote is sleek and has good solid build. Works as universal remote and I was able to even control my fireTV stick with it.

6. For gamers there is a specific gaming mode and HDMI 2.1, also panel has refresh rate of 120HZ which is pretty good.

7. One connect box allows for good cable management and allows you to hide cable clutter.

Cons:
1. Some TVs in this price range offer inbuilt soundbar and much better sound quality.

2. TV runs on Tizen OS and switching from Android TV felt apps were not up-to-date and had some issues while running apps like Voot, Sonyliv. Also, Chromecast felt better experience for casting content from mobile devices.

3. Had to purchase an additional wall mount since no gap wall mount couldn't be used because of switch board on wall. Had to shell out 2.5k for wall mount which is much more adjustable and allows free movement of TV to some extent. (more like a monitor arm)

Overall: This is a great TV given it's price (for 55 inch variant). Picture quality is great with decent audio with few shortcomings in OS. (software shortcomings can be overlooked if you own fireTV or other such android TV box)

Hello

Bought this TV, very satisfied delivery was as promised within 2 days, and i set it up on my own as I did not want to wall mount it.... I compared it with the TCL qLed TV and though both are qLed the Samsung was my choice as it had a brighter panel... 400 nits in comparison to 500 nits, and a price difference of just 6k

Picture quality is superb, panel is really bright and is very clear even in a lit up room so no problem there. Blacks are very good though not OLED standard. Colours are really bright and accurate and don’t look over vivid like in Sony (i have).

Better than the competing Sony and LG models.

This TV (55 inch) is absolutely value for money. It's picture and sound quality are amazing. The upscaling on this tv is also really good and 1080 really feels like just watching 4k content. It has hdmi 2.1, 120hz panel, freesync premium, ALLM and other gaming friendly features which makes it future proof. Some cons are that it definitely has low storage capacity and you'll be left with 250mb after downloading all the essential apps and some apps are not as optimised as they are on Android tv but there is no problem in content viewing. At this price point, there is no better QLED tv out there that can match the quality, features and upscaling capabilities of this panel. It is as good as it sounds and you should definitely go for it.
Fantastic picture and look of tv , awesome tv at this price.. frame look is so realistic check this look..

The TV is good, picture clarity on 4k Netflix and prime is good, there is a smoothness or feels a little easy on the eye, probably that's cos of the high refresh rate.

Only concern I have is TV is around 3inches think and an inch thinner would have been better. The no gap wall mount is not exactly, there is a gap as the design is not completely single border.

Art mode is good, just that you need to shell out money after the free trial, more free art would solve this problem.

Alexa is not working properly for turning on the TV, i configured with oakremote but still problems in using Alexa for basic switch on and off.

Folks wanting to get a qled and OK to spend a bit, can go for it.
Just awesome tv it the best tv ever used . the product has only one default voice assistance does not work properly !!!

A very good TV. Best part was buying from Flipkart. The 1st unit delivered had backlight bleeding issue. Flipkart was quick to understand the issue and replace the same. Thanks Flipkart for the service.

The TV has good black uniformity and good grey uniformly as well. This is not best as this TV does not have local dimming and direct led.

The sound is the best part. Well balanced speaker, no need for a soundbar. Deep enough bass for distortion free listening. I tested this against MI qled T...

Best tv for the price - bought it at 80.5k. it's the cheapest tv with hdmi 2.1 and 120hz screen refresh rate. I bought it keeping my future Xbox one series x purchase in mind.

The only downsides I see are:
Viewing angles aren't that great but I installed it in my bedroom. So, that isn't a problem.

Blacks are not as purely displayed on an oled per se but oleds are far more expensive.

Upscaling works great for the most part especially when there isn't so much action going on in the movie/game but during those action scenes, when there is fast paced camerawork; upscaling acts a bit funny especially for movies older than 2010's.

Art mode and ambient mode are a cool addition. Whether or not they are worth considering in your decision making process is a personal choice. I wouldn't say they are a must have and all TV's should follow suit but they are cool.

Inability to sideload apps since it's a tizen operating system didn't hurt me (at least as of now). All the apps I wanted (mostly streaming apps) are available in tizen app store.

Overall, one wouldn't regret purchasing especially this 55" version for the value for money it provides (I wouldn't say the same for other sizes of this tv). One worthy alternative to this tv is lg 55SM9000PTA. It also has hdmi 2.1 port but has only 100hz refresh rate but it probably trumps this tv in providing viewing angles and better operating system (webOS). Not sure how better or worse upscaling works on that tv as I haven't seen it personally.

You may choose one or other based on what you want from your tv. I chose this as I absolutely wanted a tv with 120hz refresh rate (max fps Xbox games going to play at 4k resolution) and the novelty of having a tv which works as an art piece.

Just in awe of this product, never thought I’d actually advocate something like a tv, but this beauty right here is a head turner, almost everyone who looks at this in our hall thinks it’s a painting. On the other hand the TV too doesn’t fall short of expectations, QLED is amazing and so is the sound quality! Would like to purchase additional bezels separately but can’t seem to find them in India. If you have considered this tv and you are in two minds, just go for it, you will fall in love w...

This is one of the best TVs in this price range.
True blacks, extremely good contrast, and more than decent peak brightness - the quality of QLED is awesome, you can expect that from Samsung.
The 40 watt sound is good, but you may opt for soundbar if you need surround effect and other features.
The added advantage is the HDMI 2.1 and 120hz variable refresh rate.
All in all a very good TV just like that, keeping in mind that only the 55 inch variant is value for money.
However, the main attraction which sets this TV apart is the look and as the name states, this is a piece of art. One invisible wire, zero gap wall mount and this uniform bezels all around makes it "The Frame"
All the connections - HDMI, usb, power, everything is via the one connect box which can be hidden anywhere in your cabinet along with other media devices. This TV does not require any fancy expensive tv unit. Probably the only sub 1 lakh TV to have this feature

All not positive:
Everyone may not like the OS, although I personally have no issues
The default color is over saturated and unnaturally punchy for me - may be because I came from 6 years of Sony and used to the more color calibrated view. You can easily tweek based on your likings

Major issue:
Installation via Jeeves was rescheduled a multiple times and they kept on saying customer requested cancellation. I got fed up and called samsung customer service for installation. They happily obliged and got it done in 24 hours at no extra cost - advantages of big brands. The installation was top notch with actual zero gap flush mount

Overall, this TV is worth buying and you will not be disappointed

The "Frame" lives upto its reputation and ticks all the right boxes. This review is after 10 days of usage and the experience has been truly mesmerising.
The picture engine does a superb job of upscaling normal HD quality to 4k. Watching movies is a treat. TV speakers are also good for the right sized room. Connectivity is also easy and convenient....connected readily to my bluetooth soundbar.
The Art mode is a treat for sore eyes. Samsung gives 3 months free subscription and when you eventually subscribe for it, you end up getting 4 months of free access to the Art services. Only drawback is that the Tizen app store, though it contains the popular apps, is a poor distant cousin of the Google Play Store. Smart things lets you mirror your smartphone screen to your Frame with ease.Overall a very good choice. Truly satisfied. Only regret that I went for the 50" unit instead of the 55".

Pricey but worth it for the shape-conscious
The Frame is all about looking good on a wall displaying art, and it does that extremely well—far better than any other TV I’ve seen. For that, it’s a stellar product and very, very good overall TV.

This TV is fantastic for displaying fine art, but it's not the best TV you can buy for the money.

Pros
Mounts flush to your wall
Optional colored bezels available but not in india.
Does a great job displaying static art
Cons
Has only one a 120Hz refresh rate port.
Less brightness and contrast than Samsung's best TVs
Pricey for Samsung's mid-range TV tech

The biggest disappointment is that the Frame TV doesn't come with Frame which is the USP - its like a car advertised with Sunroof but sunroof is missing and was told by Flipkart that I should have read the contents well enough before placing the order. So its like any other TV for me now.

installation and demo was mentioned free in the invoice but your service personnel charged 750 for additional wall clamp.
he was telling the screws provided with the wall adapter is not proper size so either keep the tv on table stand or pay up extra 750 ruppees. a simple metal clamp which also protrudes from the wall . another way of making extra money. I told him if the company provided the wall fittings then they ensures proper screws also. so many excuses.
but good TV, picture quality is not that okay. QLED, dark colour ghosting . cute functional remote. sound quality is good.

I feel it is worth every penny.. stands up to its name.. looks exactly like a frame.. u have to pay to get art from samsung though. The one connect box is the best part.. very very convenient.. the one connect cable is much thinner than I expected., almost invisible. Awesome connectivity.. Alexa built in. No google assistant built in but can connect to assistant via samsung smart things app. Screen mirroring works seamless. Best option if u don't want to mess around with all the wires. 65 inch varient is a bit overpriced..

Super impressed with delivery and installation of the TV. Happy with the overall purchase. The 65” was purchased for my bedroom & is massive. Great viewing experience with deep blacks (almost like an OLED). I do have a 65 UHD 4K optima projector too with a 110” screen and this TV certainly gives it tough competition though it’s 1/2 the size. Pretty impressed with the overall package. Delivery:I have placed order on 27 Jun 2020 and delivery of tv has been done on 30 Jun 2020 . The demo & installation done on 3rd July which is a quiet impressive during lockdown period.

TV pictures quality: it's nice .. no doubt, samsung have maintained that quality track records in this TV also.

Sounds: I have purchased 55 inches tv for that 40 watt sound given in specification but real scenarios it's does seems sufficient for 55 inches big tv where people are sitting a minimum gaps of 6-7 feet. Every time I need to make volume level 75-80 for nice listening. It could be better if samsung would have given a great sound.

Value for Money: I am optimistic because of taken this TV beyond my earlier decided range and converted to 12 months of emi approx rs 6834/- + 189 approx. Although flipkart has given benefit of no interest cost on EMI but still SBI card has charged minimum rs 189 toward the name of govt tax which has not been mentioned. As per given invoice rs76105 after getting no cost on EMI discount.

Other features I love very much of smartthings like connecting mobile to tv parallel and TV to mobile also which we can view tv programs on mobile..

Neither happy nor sad neutral feeling with this product..
This is our first smart TV..I brought this TV with lots and lot of expectations..After long search i selected this TV.

* Picture quality is top notch..I am satisfied with picture quality .But only drawback is I am seeing greyish light in the edges while watching the dark scenes..
* Sound is also good..Not as expected.But still satisfied..
* Connectivity is average..Some times remote is lagging . mirroring and Bluetooth connectivity is good..But always 1 sec lagging is there in screen mirroring..
* Art is a great addition..But the motion sensor in art mode is not working as expected..
* Finally I want to give a special mention to installation guys they are very good..They explained every features patiently and came one day before the mentioned time..
* But still some gap is between the TV and wall
OVERALL A DECENT PURCHASE

This is absolutely a budget future ready TV, with 120 hz refresh rate, qled TV with amazing picture quality. Would highly recommend this! Dark scenes very good contrast ratio. For gaming it's a perfect!!

The most stunning part its art mode u will love it!

Its an amzing Tv and really does look like a photo frame on the wall. I wish it was available in different fram colours as well. Otherwise, the picture quality is great and so is the variety of the amazing effects and applications they have provided.

Ordered this 4 days ago, delivery and installations are done as per the timelines. Product is EXCELLENT and value for money. No doubt in having this TV and its loaded with premium features. Connected wit SONY HT system you can feel watching a movie in theatre. Also the SD upscale is good, you can connect bluetooth ear/headphones or sound bar.

***Only one negative thing is that frame bezel is not available in India to get the frame outlook.

Apart from that all the things are EXCELLENT... recomend to buy without second thought in that price range.

It's been about 15 days since I bought this TV. Loving it absolutely think it's a great value for money and totally worthy. Be it picture quality aesthetics connectivity every aspect of this TV is great. Sound quality could have been little better or a detachable sound bar would have been great. On an whole it's a great buy.

In terms of picture quality, the TV is amazing, the colour and sharpness are spot on. There's a huge difference between my VU 65 and this one.

I was skeptical I spending the double the amount of money for this TV as compared to a budget TV but I am glad I took that step and extremely happy with the purchase.

If you can afford it then definitely go for it.

VFM for 73k when you compare with Mi tv selling 55' at 55k. You pay 18k more and get 10yr burn in warranty plus this is an Art piece not just any ordinary QLED.
The price in India is cheaper than abroad but it's disappointing that samsung doesn't provide frame options , can't event buy it as an add-on. Default Black is not the best looking "frame".
Plenty of customisation options for A/V and a treat for hard-core gamers with 120hz refresh rate. Difference between 50 & 55" is not much so do consider the 55" for twice the sound output and better refresh rate. Need min 10ft vieweing distance for ideal consumption.
Alexa and Google assistant are still half baked.
Tv does not mount flush in the wall, a few mm gap is visible.

Well said that this isn't a tv it's an experience. Classy & elegant buy, this is. Might not be the best in market when compared to OLED but budget friendly. Flipkart's delivery was in just a day & installation was done by professionals on the same day. Spent 3000 more to buy a stabilizer which is adviced as well.

Note- the wall area you planning to mount this TV on should not have even a little elevation. I had a plug point and I made it a dummy before mounting the tv.

You get 20 free arts only. For a wide range you will have to subscribe.

Do install samsung smart things in your cell phone.

The above review is for 65".

I am giving a honest review after a week of installation. The quality is superb.I just loved it. I am using it with Airtel DTH and HD channels are supperb.Just sit relax and enjoy the TV. Sound is superb.This is true no gap wall mount.

Picture quality awesome.
Sound quality also good for medium size room.
Only issue with OTT application Netflix, apple tv , prime video working fine but ZEE5 , Sony LIV, hotstar not working fine it's hung frequently those are not optimised with Tizen OS. Samsung should work on it. Also Very limited application available to download.

Most of the application also not upgraded in samsung app Store.
After close to an year after purchase, I can confidently say this is one of the best purchases I have done. This is an impressive smart tv.

After using it for about an year its a review by experience on daily basis :

As everyone let me start with the cons ;
1. The remote interface isn't as friendly navigational as my LG counterpart with mouse pointer.
2. The frames are add on that costs Rs.14000/- more as an accessory and not included in pack.
3. Unavailability of 120hz refresh rate for 50" isn't a pleasant feel as my wall space doesn't fit for 55" and i am being deprived of an important feature going for 50" which hurts.
4. Application are only limited as compared to android.

Pros:
1. Awsome picture quality with the feel of every penny worth for it.

Before this I had Sony LED TV’s and separate Apple TV device. Whenever I wanted to screen mirror my phone, it was seamless. Simply press the screen mirroring button, and mobile screen is on TV via Apple TV. Both Apple TV and mobile were on same WiFi network.

When I got this TV (Samsung Frame TV), I connected it to WiFi. Now I expected it to work in similar fashion for screen mirroring. It doesn’t. What I was told, which sounds weird- every time I have to mirror content from my phone, I have to enable hotspot on my phone (so I lose home WiFi network speed), then screen mirror the content. After this if I have to use my WiFi, I have to manually shut down my mobile hotspot so that TV can get connected to WiFi.

I was better off with my old LED TV and Apple TV.

I got this TV for 57k during the October BBD sale. I think paying anything more than 60k is definitely not worth it because there are much better options in the market from Sony & LG.

Picture Quality: It's quite good actually but in extremely high and low lighting conditions it fails to deliver the best picture clarity. Like watching a dark scenes of a horror movie at night or watching test cricket under bright sunlight you might have some occasional issues with picture clarity.

Sound Quality: It's decent for a mid sized room, it's clear and loud enough. But if you are looking for theater like experience then you definitely need additional soundbars.

Connectivity: In this aspect the TV stands out because everytime you want to connect your PS4 or laptop or Pendrive etc you don't have to search for ports behind the dusty & cobweb laden areas of a regular TV. The ports are right behind the One Connect Box.

Cons: There is one big issue which you must remember. There is one optic fibre cable running from the TV to One Connect Box and the cost of this cable is 7-8k. Incidentally this cable breaks easily, a simple act of pushing/pulling the One Connect Box can damage the cable and you end up shelling out 7-8k not to mention that this part doesn't come under warranty & Samsung dealers never keep it in stock. So if you happen to break it unintentionally be prepared to wait for 10-15 days at least, since this is a unique wire which can not be brought through off market route either.

Verdict: Buy this TV for the Art mode feature for which you need to pay 3k per year atleast to get access to the high quality art gallery. If you don't mind paying then go ahead with this TV.
FYI: If you are an Art fan then this TV will surprise you with art works of every known artist of the world starting from Leonardo Da Vinci to Vince Van Gogh. You will need a high speed Internet connection to be able to use this Art mode feature.

It's an excellent TV with amazing picture quality and decent sound. All family/friends who saw were impressed by the concept. I bought in June 2020 and then again for a family in October.

Picture: 9.5/10 - Needs some fine tuning for better experience. default is too bright and colors are not so natural. Movie Maker Mode was added recently via update, but it becomes too dim in daytime and hard to watch. I am using movie mode with slight customization for more natural picture. There were visible judders when there were fast moving scenes initially with the default settings. With some tuning they have become negligible. Dolby Vision is not supported by Samsung .This maybe a limitation with some people, but I dont have problem in this regard. HDR10, HDR10+, HLG are supported and shouldn't be too much difference wrt Dolby Vision as the content at the moment is limited. Maybe in a few years it may catch up, but I am not too bothered.

Sound: 7.5/10 - Its decent loud and little bass is there, but not enough to justify the movie watching experience this TV can provide with the Picture. Have added Samsung Q60T soundbar and now its much better. The bass from the soundbar provides the thump we get in theater for watching movies. Samsung supports Dolby Digital Plus on the Frame TV and Dolby Atmos via HDMI passthrough and does not support DTS codecs. Its own soundbar Q60T has DTS-X support which is weird.

Software: 6/10 -
ON TV:
While it provides most commonly used apps, also its Netflix certified so Netflix opens instantly, the apps dont get the update as frequently as android. Like Hostar added many 4K titles on android, but Samsung dint initially (not sure if they are added now as I uninstalled) Since its not android, cant side load any app as well. I have added FireTV 4k stick. I unsinstalled all removable apps from the TV and installed all required apps on FireTV stick. The TV remote can manage most functions of the FireTV stick remote, so it's easily manageable.

On Smartthings app:
Though they advertise LIVE streaming on the app from the TV or streaming sound from TV to app, I don't see the options. I can only use the multiview or cast from youtube etc. I reset the TV and reinstalled the app many times. If could just get the sound on my phone, I could use my headphones without disturbing others at night. I dont want to spend on bluetooth headphones as I have many wired ones which would go to waster otherwise.

Features: 100/10: the art mode is its USP and no other TV can beat this. My trial period is over and 299/month is expensive. free mode only give 20 basic artwork which one will get bored quite easily. I have upload some custom artwork and photos and using them now. If Samsung makes it 99/month and I will subscribe. Haven't used the ambient mode much. Connect your mobile with TV via Bluetooth and play music directly from mobile on the TV - no need to buy those cheap bluetooth speakers. No Gap Wallmount for me is a bit wobbly and there's a little gap on one side of the tv. I think is due to uneven wall surface, nothing Samsung can do about. Can be connected as a 2nd screen for computers, not much useful though for bigger screen sizes as its very difficult to work with such large screen.

Connectivity 9/10: Support eARC (for soundbars) on HDMI3 and a total of 4 HDMI ports which are very generous. Can play directly from HDD/pendrive (almost all formats). Optical, RCA are also there, so most things are covered.(I am not using any DTH and using only steaming apps). Supports bluetooth speakers. TV manual says it supports Q-Symphony with supported soundbars. It dint work for me with Q60 soundbar and the customer care cant help.

Others: Remote is easy to use and well built. One Connect box simplifies the hassle of cable handling in a much better way. There are some software glitches here and there, but nothing too major. Initially there were issues with the Prime App few timeas but reinstalling from the app menu solved it.

Price: I bought for 80.5k in June 2020 with card discounts, but now it went as low as 71-72K with bump up exchange on even 24 inch TV during sales. ( I really could use the offer if it was available). If you have/can arrange for a small working TV, the bump up discount is additional savings.

Pros:
- outstanding picture and sound quality
- picture frame functionality
- design
- "one box" - no visible wire clutter
- great connectivity with Samsung phones (mirroring, etc.)

Cons:
- no analog audio output
- user manual is useless
- smart things app for the TV on phone is complicated and is not practical

My one major gripe is that there is no 3.5mm audio out to be found anywhere for wired headphones or speakers. The "one box" is a great concept, they could have easily fit one more small plug on it... The only way around to get analog audio out of the the the HDMI interface by a HDMI audio extractor unit (2000Rs+) or through the optical output which only works with 5.1 content.
